data.meta_description: Currently enrolled in our Respiratory Care Program? If so, you are eligible for several scholarships. Learn the details.
data.text:
Program: Respiratory Care

Pathway: Health Science

If you are currently enrolled in our Respiratory Care Program, you are eligible for the scholarships listed below.

No application is necessary; however, a statement of financial need is required for those scholarships that have need as a criterion.

Additional information concerning scholarship, loans and student employment is available from the Student Financial Aid Services.

Application for loans, scholarships or student employment may be made during the initial interview with a counselor.

New Scholarship

TCC National Board for Respiratory Care (NBRC) Respiratory Care Scholarship

Awarded to first-year TCC Respiratory Care students accepted into the Respiratory Care Program

Based on:

Demonstrated academic achievement and

Expressed interest in pursuing a Respiratory Care Practitioner (RCP) License

Amount awarded: $1000.

For more information, see TCC Foundation: NBRC Respiratory Care Scholarship Application.

Fall Scholarships

Respiratory Care Leadership Scholarship

Based on leadership, scholastic ability, attitude, clinical performance and financial need

Sponsored by TCC

Spring Scholarship

Cristine Bernardez-Oakes Scholarship

Awarded to a second-year student

Based upon scholastic ability, clinical performance, attitude and interest in the profession

From the Bernardez and Farrar families

All program scholarships range in value from $250 to $1250.

Other Scholarships

Area Hospital Scholarships

Some area hospitals offer scholarships that cover part or all of the expenses of the program. The scholarships are based upon a commitment to work for the hospital following graduation. Contact the Program Coordinator for details.

The Lambda Beta Society Scholarships

The Lambda Beta Society is the National Honor Society for the Profession of Respiratory Care.

See Lambda Beta Scholarships to learn about the society's scholarship and awards program.

The Respiratory Care Foundation of Texas (RCFT)

RCFT provides educational grants for respiratory care students in Texas.

The deadline for submitting applications for grants is April 15. The grants will be awarded at the Texas Society for Respiratory Care Annual Meeting.

For more information, visit the:

RCFT Facebook page or

RCFT website

American Association of Respiratory Care (AARC)

See AARC: Scholarships & Loans for information about scholarships for undergraduate and graduate students.

Contact
